meanings.sent1: She will mak a beautiful painting for the art show.
meanings.sent2: The baker will mak a delicious cake for the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to mak a rabbit appear out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to mak happiness bloom in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to mak the flowers in the garden grow taller.

meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy can mak a stomach ache.
meanings.sent2: The storm will mak the trees sway in the wind.
meanings.sent3: His silly jokes always seem to mak laughter erupt in the room.
meanings.sent4: The loud music can mak the windows rattle in the house.
meanings.sent5: The sudden noise did not mak the cat move from its cozy spot.

meanings.sent1: She used clay to mak a small sculpture of a bird.
meanings.sent2: The artist will mak a detailed sketch of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to mak a sandcastle but it kept falling apart.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to mak a path through the confusion.
meanings.sent5: The wind can mak the sand dunes shift and change shape over time.

meanings.definition: To constitute or amount to something
meanings.sent1: Each ingredient will mak a unique flavor in the soup.
meanings.sent2: The different colors will mak a beautiful rainbow in the sky.
meanings.sent3: His hard work will surely mak a difference in the end.
meanings.sent4: Every drop of rain will mak a ripple in the pond.
meanings.sent5: The individual voices will mak a harmonious choir performance.
